dialogues.WYATT:
[1]Forget it. 
[2]I said forget it, answer's no, I Don't want the job and that's Final.  I'm going to Tombstone and Nothin' short of dyin's gonn Stop me.  Good day. 
[3]No Marshal, you don't understand. I'm through with lawing, I'm Through with the whole Proposition.  Forever.  I did my Duty, now I'd like to get on with My life.  That is if you don't Mind.  Jesus.  Good day now. 
[4]Already got a guilty conscience, Might as well have the money too. 
[5]Hey!  Virgil!  My God!  Morgan!  Hey, Boy!  You look great!  Both of you! 
[6]Allie-girl...And Louisa!  You're So lovely.  I'm at your feet, Darlin'.  Just at your feet. Guess it's only right.  Ma always Said you were the prettiest. 
[7]Mattie, they're here!  Folks this Is Celia Ann but you can call her Mattie.  Or even Mrs.  Earp if you Prefer. 
[8]Boy, I sure been dreamin' about This.  God!  Since forever!  Wait! 
[9]There, look at that!  God Almighty 
[10]Don't talk, just...yeah. 
[11]All right, now let's go make our fortune. 
[12]Hope so.  Clean up with this boy. 
[13]Come up to the fire, honey. 
[14]They're just lonely is all.  Hell, I howl myself sometimes. 
[15]Look at that.  Busted.  Brand new Money Ward, too.  33 years old And I don't even have a decent Watch.  'Bout time I started Lookin' out for myself. 
[16]We're gonna do it, boys.  Gonna Get ours.  Feel it in my bones. All we have to do is keep our Eyes on that brass ring. 
[17]Maybe, yeah.  Hell, I don't know. 
[18]Got me.  Somethin'.  Nothin'.  I Don't know. 
[19]Really?  What about hell?  They got A sign or what? 
[20]Well that's your problem.  Hey Virge, see anything of Doc while You were in Prescott? 
[21]I miss Doc.  I miss that ol' rip. 
[22]He makes me laugh. 
[23]Just this minute.  I'm Wyatt Earp, These're my brothers- 
[24]Gave all that up.  Going into business. 
[25]Guess we'll take all three. 
[26]...and easy on the grain, I don't want 'em too fidgety. 
[27]Lotta law around here.  Just met the Sheriff. 
[28]Just like any other hard cases. Gotta know how to handle 'em. 
[29]What about all these saloons? 
[30]Let me have one of those cigars. Kinda nice in here.  You run it? 
[31]Well, excuse me for askin', Milt, But isn't it kinda dead in here? 
[32]Why don't you get rid of him and Get yourself straight dealer? 
[33]Just wanted to let you know You're sitting in my chair. 
[34]Yeah.  It's a fact. 
[35]Don't need to go heeled to get The bulge on a dub like you. 
[36]Yeah.  It's a fact. 
[37]Damn right you're scared.  I can See it in your eyes. 
[38]Go ahead.  Skin it.  Skin that Smoke wagon and see what happens. 
[39]I'm getting tired of your gas. Jerk that pistol and go to work. 
[40]I said throw down, boy. 
[41]You gonna do something or just Stand there and bleed? 
[42]No, I didn't think so.  Here, Milt.  Keepsake, hang it over the Bar.  All right, youngster.  Out You go... 
[43]And don't come back.  Ever. 
[44]See how easy that was? 
[45]Well we're off and running.  Just Acquired us a quarter-interest in The game at the Oriental. 
[46]So to speak. 
[47]Doc!  How the hell are you? 
[48]Didn't you always say gambling's An honest trade? 
[49]Depends how you look at it.  I Mean it's not like anybody's Holding a gun to their heads. 
[50]Sheriff Behan, Doc Holliday. 
[51]Fine, fine.  But I was thinkin', You know what this town really Needs is a race track. 
[52]I know him.  That's Creek Johnson. 
[53]Jack... 
[54]What was that all about? 
[55]Not a prayer.  Nice meetin' you. 
[56]But who was the Devil? 
[57]I'll be damned... 
[58]Comin' to the Oriental, Virge? 
[59]Better go with 'em, honey.  Here's Where I leave you. 
[60]Honey, I gotta start makin' money. 
[61]Well I guess I don't have to go Right now.  I guess I could stay a little while. 
[62]No really, I can stay a while. 
[63]All right, well, good night. 
[64]I'm your man... You win again.  Well played, sir. You are on fire. 
[65]Awful lot of money. 
[66]You're the doctor. sad news, friend. 
[67]So now we're in the mining Business.  Turning into regular Tycoons.  Gonna call this one the Mattie Blaylock.  Mattie'll get a Kick out of that, it's her maiden Name. 
[68]Just his style, Morg.  Doesn't Mean anything. 
[69]Well yeah.  Pretty much.  I mean I Was no angel when we met but People change Doc.  I mean sooner Or later you gotta grow up. 
[70]"She"? 
[71]I don't know.  Probably ignore her. 
[72]I'd ignore her.  People can Change, Doc. 
[73]Oh, hell... 
[74]Satisfied? 
[75]Getting drunk, Doc. 
[76]I'm retired. 
[77]I heard you the first time. 
[78]He's drunk. 
[79]Curly Bill, huh?  Who was that Other idiot? 
[80]Yeah, and dangerous. 
[81]Why don't you just leave it alone? 
[82]None of my business, Fred. 
[83]Maybe I ought to go out there. 
[84]Go wake up Virgil. Hey Milt, lend me a sidearm, will you? 
[85]Put his clothes out. 
[86]He just killed a man. 
[87]Well I'm not so go home. 
[88]You.  Come here a second. 
[89]You die first, get it?  The others Might get me in a rush but before That I'm gonna make your head Into a canoe.  Understand? 
[90]Come on, you... 
[91]There.  He'll keep till morning 
[92]I know, I need a keeper. 
[93]...but he says did I actually see it happen and I said, no, when I arrived Fred'd already been shot. So the judge said, can't have a Murder without a witness-case Dismissed.  Can you beat it?  After All that.  Oh hell, who cares, None of my business anyways. 
[94]You tell 'em, Virge. 
[95]You know, I was thinkin', maybe We ought to open our own place. That's the real money.  Build it Up, milk it for all it's worth, Then sell it off for a bundle and Breeze out of this burg with more Money than Croesus and ready to Live like kings.  Let's you and me Take a walk around town, Virge, See if we can scout us out a Couple of nice lots. 
[96]Pretty fun too, isn't it? 
[97]Cat got your tongue? 
[98]Wait a minute, Virgil!  Where you goin'? 
[99]Virgil, please.  Don't do this to me. 
[100]Nothing to do with me?  I'm your Brother for Christ's sake.  God, I Don't believe this. Talk to him, will you?  Or hit him. Oh no, don't tell me... 
[101]Listen to me, both of you.  This Is no good.  This is trouble we Don't need.  For the first time in Our lives we got a chance to stop Wandering and finally be a Family.  Do this and you throw it All away.  You saw what happened To Fred White. 
[102]Yeah? 
[103]All right, say you're right, say You don't get yourself killed. There's something else. It's too late for Virge, he Already rolled his bone.  But it's Not too late for you, Morg. 
[104]All the years I worked the Cowtowns, I was only ever mixed Up in one shooting.  Just one.  A Man got killed.  Wasn't my fault, Just doin' my job.  I don't even Know if it was my bullet that Dropped him, but... I don't kno, It's sort of hard to explain.  At First I just felt funny, you Know, kind of clammy inside.  But When it finally sunk in what I'd Done... Believe me, boy, you Don't ever want to feel that way. Not ever. Didn't even make a dent, did I? You're both makin' a big mistake. 
[105]This Hooker's ranch? 
[106]You seen anything of a man on Horseback leading a black Stallion? 
[107]Well you must've seen somethin', The trail runs right by your Waterhole. Oh, I see.  So it must've been a Cowboy, right?  Really got you People treed, don't they? 
[108]McMasters, isn't it?  Listen, you Seen a black stallion with- 
[109]I'm not a lawman, I'm just a Private citizen getting' my Property back 
[110]So what about you Cowboys anyway? 
[111]Yeah, but some of the things they Say your brothers've done... 
[112]Where'd you get that horse? 
[113]I asked where you got him. 
[114]Look, I don't want any trouble With you but that's my horse and I mean to have him back.  One way Or another. 
[115]Look kid, I know what it's like, I was a kid, too.  Even stole a Horse once.  But you can't-- 
[116]Make you a deal.  My brother took Over the Marshal's office in Tombstone.  Got it in his head He's gonna make the place safe For widows and orphans.  You and Your boys stay out of his way, I'll make sure he stays out of yours. 
[117]They were all gonna jump me back There.  What ever happened to one Against one? 
[118]And how come you call yourselves Cowboys?  Cowhands ride for the brand. 
[119]This brand. 
[120]Maybe I jumped the gun.  Maybe Those Cowboys aren't near as bad As they're painted.  You know I Was thinkin', there's a lot of Money in the cattle business... 
[121]Business is business.  Don't have To love 'em to work with 'em.  Not If there's money in it. 
[122]Oh, hell... 
[123]We've never actually met.  My Name's- 
[124]I know what it means. 
[125]Easy now... That mare's in season. 
[126]They know.  It's the scent.  We Better split 'em up. 
[127]Yeah, I'm an oak all right. 
[128]You're not that crazy, are you? 
[129]You know you almost got us both Killed back there? 
[130]You'd die for fun? 
[131]I laugh sometimes 
[132]Am I happy?  I don't know.  Happy As the next man, I guess.  I don't Laugh all day long like an idiot, If that's what you mean. 
[133]I'm not touchy, I just, it's a Silly question, that's all.  Am I Happy?  Are you happy? 
[134]What about her? 
[135]Where do you get these questions? 
[136]I don't know, make some money, Have some kids, you know. 
[137]How would you know? 
[138]Well I ought to know my own mind And I'm tellin' you what suits me Is a family and kids.  That suits Me right down to the ground.  In Fact, that's my idea of heaven. All right, what's your idea of heaven? 
[139]You mean Behan? Then why are you with him? 
[140]The way you talk.  Never heard a Woman talk like that. 
[141]Well you're different, no arguing That.  But you're a lady all right. I'll take my oath on it. 
[142]I don't know, doesn't make any Sense.  I almost can't look at You.  Like it hurts. 
[143]God... 
[144]Then let's make sure we get our Money's worth 
[145]Fortuitous even. 
[146]Easy to fix.  Wyatt Berry Stapp Earp. 
[147]Josie... No, I'm gonna call you Sadie. 
[148]Well you'll always be Sadie to me. 
[149]Getting late.  We better get back. 
[150]Look, it's too much of a tangle. I already cast my lot.  I can't go Back and I can't sneak, feel back Enough as it is. 
[151]I didn't mean it that way. 
[152]I can't, I'm sorry.  Forgive me. 
[153]That the bottle Lou gave you? Better go easy on that stuff. 
[154]Out ridin'.  So... how you doin'? 
[155]Really?  You sure? 
[156]Well, I was thinking, we've Already made a pile of money. Maybe we should just pull up Stakes and move on.  And we could Stay on the move, you know?  Just Keep going, see the world.  Live On room service the rest of our Lives.  How'd that be? 
[157]Just thinkin' out loud.  Forget it. 
[158]I know.  And nobody can make him. 
[159]Been hittin' it awful hard, Doc. 
[160]But Doc- 
[161]Sorry, sorry... 
[162]Nice voice. 
[163]Virgil, don't!  Take it easy!  Ike, Just go home and forget it, will you? 
[164]Get a doctor!  Virgil, give me a hand. 
[165]What the hell's going on? 
[166]Just stay calm, use your head. It'll be all right.  Just the Same, though... Guess you better swear me in. 
[167]Yeah, well, I swore a lot of things. 
[168]Easy, Virge, they're just tryin' To egg us on. 
[169]Don't worry, Doc, it's not your problem. You don't have to mix up in this. 
[170]Wait till the liquor wears off. Once they start getting headaches They'll lose interest. 
[171]You'll never make that stick. 
[172]Virge, that's a misdemeanor.  You Go down there to arrest 'em, Something goes wrong, maybe this Time somebody gets his head Broke, suddenly it's a mess and It won't end there, you'll have Cowboys comin' around lookin' for Trouble from here to Christmas. You gonna risk all that over a Misdemeanor? 
[173]All right, Virge, your call.  But Give Doc the shotgun.  They'll be Less apt to get nervy if they see Him on the street howitzer. 
[174]Well... Come on, boys. 
[175]Virge, you're makin' the arrest. You make contact, I'll back you Up.  Morgan'll back me up, Doc'll Keep an eye out for trouble.  And Keep your hands on your guns. They even look like they're gonna Start something, buffalo 'em. Right over the head. 
[176]Look at 'em all.  They love it. How in the hell'd we get Ourselves into this? 
[177]Oh, great.  Disarmed my ass... 
[178]Oh, my God... 
[179]This fight's commenced.  Get to Fightin' or get away! 
[180]Behind us! 
[181]I don't think I'll let you arrest Us today, Behan.  Maybe tomorrow. 
[182]Guess we did our good deed for today. 
[183]I'm sorry.  If there was any other- 
[184]How you doin', boy? 
[185]I know, kid.  I know.  Me too. 
[186]Mattie.  What about this? 
[187]'Least you admit it. 
[188]Look, Mattie, I know you're- 
[189]All right, look.  I can make it Right, I can make this up to you, Mattie.  I can, I swear. 
[190]I'm the one made a mess.  Made a Right fair mess of the whole thing. 
[191]All they ever did was make fun of him. 
[192]Don't want any more trouble, Ringo. 
[193]I'm not gonna fight you, there's No money in it.  Sober up.  Come On, boys. 
[194]Bundle up, Virge.  Cold out there. 
[195]That didn't sound like thunder. 
[196]Virgil? 
[197]It's all my fault.  If I hadn't been So damn smart, if I'd just... Oh God, Virge, I'm so sorry. 
[198]Virgil, what am I going to do? 
[199]No?  Brothers to the bone, right? 
[200]Morgan, are you crazy?  They're Out gunning for us!  What the Hell're you doin'? 
[201]Morg, use your head. 
[202]I know, I was wrong.  But Morg, Look, we got to get out. 
[203]I just got it fixed. 
[204]No, no!  Get the doctor!  Jesus Christ! 
[205]Oh, no, get her out of her!  Jesus! 
[206]Somebody shut that dog up! 
[207]Will somebody get the damn dog out- 
[208]Easy Morg, don't think about that now. 
[209]Morgan?  Morgan! 
[210]No, no, get away, get away from me... 
[211]Whore!  Filthy whore!  Get away From me! 
[212]I want you to know it's over. We're leaving and we're not Coming back. 
[213]Carthage, really?  I'm from Monmouth. 
[214]If the Lord is my friend. 
[215]Know why you're here? 
[216]They're nothing.  They're nobody. I want the Cowboys.  All of 'em.  I Mean to break 'em up, drive 'em Out of the territory. 
[217]I'll pay you 500 each in advance And I'll mount you on those. 
[218]Got a sheaf of federal warrants. Being in the Territories it's up To our discretion how they're Served.  That means we got the Cowboys without quarter.  The Black flag, brother.  No Prisoners, no mercy, amen. 
[219]The minute we start we'll be Going against local and county Law.  If we fail the U.S. Government won't be able to lift A finger to help us.  Nevertheless I want you to understand we carry The full force and authority of The law of this land. 
[220]Raise your right hands.  Do you Solemnly swear to uphold the laws And constitution of the United States of America and to protect her citizens to the best of your Ability, even at the cost of your Own life? 
[221]All right, let's wring 'em out! 
[222]United States Marshals!  Reach! 
[223]One more word and I'll blind you. Get over there! 
[224]All right, run 'em off. 
[225]All right, breed.  Dig in. 
[226]Felt his liver go on that last One.  Get him to a doctor or he'll Be dead in a couple hours. 
[227]Drop his horse. 
[228]A human life.  Twelve dollars. 
[229]Look at him.  That's how you'll All end up if you don't get it Through your head: it's over, The Cowboys're finished.  Forever. So tell the others and get out of The Territory 'cause next time I Leave no one alive.  Understand? No one.  You been warned. All right, burn it!  Everything! 
[230]Leave that trash where it lays. 
[231]I know that cut.  You mean there's A waterhole near there? 
[232]We'll see about that. 
[233]Wait... wait... steady... 
[234]Now! 
[235]Lay on! 
[236]Come on! 
[237]So he can tell the story. 
[238]There's no reasoning with him. 
[239]They're wise by now.  Which is Next, Iron Springs?  Yeah, let's Try there, Iron Springs. 
[240]We'll go around that way, come up on foot. 
[241]No. 
[242]No. 
[243]No... 
[244]No... 
[245]No... 
[246]No! 
[247]No! 
[248]No... 
[249]No... 
[250]I don't know.  It all happened so Fast.  If I'd had a chance to Think about it I guess I probably Would've been scared but... Swear To God, Doc, I just don't know. 
[251]Sure... 
[252]Mounts're getting jaded.  We're Gonna have to find a place to Rest 'em up. 
[253]Doc... 
[254]Grab him. 
[255]Horse're pretty well fagged and We got a sick man with us. 
[256]Sorry about your friend. And I'm sorry about... 
[257]You did.  Well... thank you. 
[258]Wait! 
[259]Goodbye. 
[260]Damn... Damn! 
[261]See how she breezed out of here. Like she had wings.  Funny thing But I can't really remember how She looked.  I can remember parts Of her clear as crystal, her Mouth, her walk, how she shut her Eyes when she laughed, little Bits and pieces, but not the Whole package.  Can't put it Together for some reason. 
[262]Cards in spades.  I'm in love with Every second of her life.  Hell, I'll probably love her when I'm dust. 
[263]We should get moving. 
[264]I don't like it. 
[265]You tell Ringo... just tell him I'll be there. 
[266]I made a promise. 
[267]But I'd do it, I'd get that one Into him.  So help me God, I would. 
[268]What makes a man like Ringo, Doc? What makes him do the things he does? 
[269]So what does he want? 
[270]Revenge?  For what? 
[271]Remember how I said it all Happened so fast with Curly Bill I didn't have time to think about it? Well I've had plenty of time To think about this.  I spent most Of my life since I was born not Knowing what I want out of life, Just chasin' my tail.  But now, For the first time I know exactly What I want.  And who.  And that's The damnable misery of it. I can't beat him, can I? 
[272]That's all right, Doc.  Don't worry. 
[273]They're not givin' you any safe Conduct.  Soon as the shooting Starts kick east for the New Mexico line.  Well... 
[274]I know.  Me neither. 
[275]Dear God, this is the last Battle.  I worked it out in my Head every which way and I know There's no way I'm comin' through This alive.  You've preserved me This far so I only ask one more Favor: just let me live long Enough to kill that man.  Thy will Be done and there's an amen to it. 
[276]What happened? 
[277]All right, what's it to be?  New Mexico's that way. 
[278]So're the Cowboys.  They're up That road right now, waiting to Jump us. 
[279]How you feelin', Doc? 
[280]Hurts.  Hurts pretty bad. 
[281]All right, Doc... 
[282]All I ever wanted was to live a Normal life. 
[283]That's great coming from you. 
[284]Then what do I do? 
[285]All right.  Then what? 
[286]Did you ever see the sun come up Over the Rockies?  It hits all of A sudden and below there's California and you swear you're Looking at heaven. 
[287]I have nothing left.  I have Nothing to give you.  I have no Pride, no dignity, no money.  I Don't even know how we'll make a Living.  But I promise I'll love You every second of your life. 
[288]There.  It'll come up over that ridge. 
[289]Get ready, here it comes!  Here it comes!
dialogues.DOC:
[1]500? Sly boots, must be a peach of a hand. 
[2]Bless you, darling Darling!  Are you mad?  You're not Wearing a bustle.  How lewd! 
[3]Ed Bailey, you look like you're Just ready to burst.  Well call me A fool but I guess I'll just have To call.  Cover your ears, darling. 
[4]Isn't that a daisy? 
[5]Now Ed, are we cross? 
[6]Why Ed, what an ugly thing to Say!  Does this mean you're not my Friend anymore?  You know, Ed, if I thought you weren't my friend I Don't think I could bear it. 
[7]There, now we can be friends Again.  But remember, Ed, Friendship is trust-so please Don't hurt me. 
[8]Does it hurt?  A lot?  Good. 
[9]Well, good evening then. 
[10]I calculate that's the end of This town.  And let's don't bother About the luggage, darling. 
[11]My sweet clever Magyar, so that's Why you're not wearing a bustle. 
[12]Perfect, Wyatt.  Simply perfect. 
[13]Since when is faro a business? 
[14]I said poker's an honest trade. Only suckers buck the tiger.  The Odds are all with the house. 
[15]That's what I love about Wyatt. He can talk himself into anything. 
[16]Oh sorry, Johnny, I forgot all About you.  You can go now.  Just Leave the shotgun. 
[17]Forgive me if I don't shake hands. 
[18]Little ahead of yourselves, Aren't you?  This is just a mining Camp. 
[19]I can hardly wait. 
[20]Very cosmopolitan. 
[21]Sheriff, may I present a pair of Fellow sophisticates, Turkey Creek Jack Johnson and Texas Jack Vermillion?  Watch your ear, Creek. 
[22]Well, an enchanted moment 
[23]Kate, you know the Earps. 
[24]Very instructive 
[25]You may indeed.  If you get lucky. 
[26]And what a maiden, pure as the Driven snow, I'm sure. 
[27]So tell me, Wyatt.  I'm curious. Do you actually consider youself A married man?  Forsaking all Others? 
[28]I see.  And what would you do if "she" walked in her right now? 
[29]You know damn well who I mean. That dusky-hued lady Satan. 
[30]Ignore her? 
[31]I'll remember you said that. 
[32]I stand corrected.  Wyatt.  You're An oak. 
[33]Here's a man you should meet, Mr. Fabian.  Excellent character study For you, the real-life actual Melancholy Dane. 
[34]Well he hems, he haws, he talks Out of both sides of his Mouth-but all on a very high Plane, just like Hamlet. 
[35]That's the rumor. 
[36]Not me.  I'm in my prime. 
[37]And you must be Ringo.  Look, Darling, Johnny Ringo.  The Deadliest pistoleer since Wild Bill, they say.  What do you Think, darling?  Should I hate him? 
[38]Yes, but there's just something About him.  Something around The eyes, I don't know, reminds me Of... me.  No.  I'm sure of it, I Hate him. 
[39]In vino veritas. 
[40]Credat Judaeus Apella. 
[41]In pace requiescat. 
[42]Evidently Mr. Ringo's an educated Man.  Now I really hate him. 
[43]Enough?  Never. 
[44]What? 
[45]I see, well this happens to be a Nocturne. 
[46]You know, Frederic-fucking-Chopin. 
[47]You will or you won't.  Don't look To me.  I'm going to sleep. 
[48]I have two guns.  One for each of you. 
[49]Wyatt!  Just in time.  Pull up a chair. 
[50]Nonsense, I have not yet begun to Defile myself. 
[51]I won't be pawed at, thank you Very much 
[52]Why, Ike, whatever do you mean? 
[53]Maybe poker's not your game, Ike. I know, let's have a spelling Contest! 
[54]Well that certainly was a bust.  I Want my money back.  Come, Darling, let's seek our Entertainment elsewhere. 
[55]Nothing.  Not a thing.  I'm right As the mail. 
[56]So what does that mean? 
[57]Well, that sounds inviting. 
[58]Better. 
[59]We must talk, darling.  It appears We have to... redefine the nature Of our association. 
[60]Not exactly... 
[61]Yes, I know.  You are a good woman. 
[62]Then again, you may be the Antichrist. 
[63]What the hell's going on?  I've Had five people walk up to me Saying the Clantons and McLaurys Are gunning for me. 
[64]That's a hell of a thing for you To say to me. 
[65]You're a daisy if you do! 
[66]You call that shooting? 
[67]That's just my game. 
[68]On three?  You call it. 
[69]Can't you see why he did it? 
[70]And so she walked out of our Lives forever. 
[71]Oh... All right. 
[72]You know why I'm here.  My Hypocrisy only goes so far. 
[73]Say something witty. 
[74]It appears he missed an excellent Chance to keep his mouth shut. 
[75]They saw us.  Here they come. 
[76]Don't touch me! 
[77]Not half as bad as I feel. 
[78]Wyatt Earp is my friend. 
[79]I don't. 
[80]Look! 
[81]Wyatt! 
[82]Come on! 
[83]Wyatt, my God!  You're shot to pieces! 
[84]I don't believe it.  He's clean! 
[85]I'm telling you, there isn't a Mark on him. 
[86]I'm a man without fear, Wyatt.  I Literally don't care if I live or Die.  But even I can't fight human Instinct.  Somebody suddenly Starts shooting at me, I duck. But you... what on earth were You thinking about? 
[87]Down at the creek.  Walking on water. 
[88]Don't touch me, God damn it!  Just Don't touch me!  Come on... 
[89]A man like Ringo's got a great Empty hole right through the Middle of him and no matter what He does he can't ever fill it.  He Can't kill enough or steal enough Or inflict enough pain to ever Fill it.  And it drives him mad. Sick mad.  Cold and dirty. 
[90]What does he want?  He wants revenge. 
[91]Being born. 
[92]No, wait, I'll go with you... 
[93]I'm sorry.  I'm sorry, Wyatt.  God, I'm so sorry. 
[94]Never got to wear one of those. 
[95]Why Johnny Ringo, you look like Somebody just walked over your grave. Oh, I wasn't quite as sick as I Made out. 
[96]I beg to differ.  We started a Fight we never got to finish. Play for blood, remember? 
[97]I wasn't. And this time it's legal. 
[98]Say when. 
[99]Come on!  Come on! 
[100]Oh Johnny.  You're no daisy, no Daisy at all. 
[101]Poor soul, he was so high-strung. Afraid the strain was more than He could bear. 
[102]Let's go!  My horse is over here. 
[103]I just wanted to see what it felt Like.  Here... 
[104]Well hell, Wyatt.  Wyatt, I want You to meet Father Feeney.  Father Feeney's just been initiating me Into the mysteries of the great And ancient Church of Rome.  You See, it appears my hypocrisy Knows no bounds. 
[105]Rather an obvious question under The circumstances, don't you Agree?  A better one might be how Do you feel? 
[106]I imagine it would, yes.  So now We can add self-pity to your list Of frailties. 
[107]You think I'm kidding.  You're the Most fallible, wrong-headed, self- Deluding, just generally Benighted jackass I've ever Known.  Yet, withal, even at your Worst, you're the only human Being in my entire life who ever Gave me hope. 
[108]When will you wake up?  You Wouldn't know a normal life if it Bit you in the ass. 
[109]I played the cards I was dealt, Wyatt.  Your problem is you're Always trying to play someone Else's.  Allow me to tell you the Truth and thus set you free: There is no happiness, Wyatt There is no normal life.  There's Only life, that's all.  Just life. The rest is relative. 
[110]First you can grab that black- Haired woman and make her your own. 
[111]Run.  Take that girl and start Running.  Run and don't look back. All your life you been running And looking back and just barely Existing and calling it getting By.  This time run and don't look Back and call it living.  Live Every second, live it right up to The hilt.  Live, Wyatt... Live for me. 
[112]Wyatt, please, if you were ever My friend, if you ever had even The smallest feeling for me, Leave.  Leave now.  Please. 
[113]Never mind, Wyatt.  I know.  Just go. 
[114]Now let's see, Father.  What was That monkey show you were talking about? 
[115]That's it.  Better start that ball rolling. 
[116]I'll be damned... This is funny.
dialogues.CURLY BILL:
[1]So how'd you like our little Carry-on over at that rancho? Kinda hit the spot didn't it? 
[2]Gracias. 
[3]Hold up, jefe.  Got a joke I wanna Tell you. 
[4]Now how'd he figure that out? 
[5]A sick horse?  What the hell... 
[6]Oh, we had a big time! The Old Man, Curly Bill, and Ringo rein up and look out at the sun rising magnificently from the desert floor.  The Old man stretches his legs in the stirrups, taking out a whiskey flask. 
[7]What'd the Messican mean, a sick Horse's gonna get us?  Didn't make No sense. 
[8]Well now that's a little more Like it. 
[9]Shut up, Zwing.  Sit here, Billy. 
[10]Prettiest man I ever saw 
[11]Let him alone. 
[12]That's great!  That's our kinda stuff! 
[13]Know what I'd do?  I'd take the Deal then crawfish and drill that Ol' Devil in the ass.  How 'bout You, Johnny?  What would you do? 
[14]Wyatt Earp, huh?  I heard of you. 
[15]Good.  That's real good. 
[16]Shut up, Ike. 
[17]I feel like doin' somethin'. Getting woolly. Hey, Chinky!  Come here a minute... 
[18]Boy, I feel great!  Full of that Hop I got from Chinky.  I feel Just capitol!  You boys go ahead. I'm gonna stick around awhile, Howl at the moon. 
[19]Well, howdy, Fred! 
[20]Why sure, dad.  I'm only in fun. Here she is. 
[21]Crack me back of the head like Some stinkin' bull.  Hell, you Ain't no fightin' man, you're Just a cop. 
[22]Give him his horse, Billy. 
[23]Shut up. Give him his horse, Billy. 
[24]Feel bad about ol' Fred.  Just Can't hold back when I'm feelin' Woolly.  Still, feel kinda bad. But now we're square.  Anyway no Use for holdin' a grudge.  I Deserved a rap in the head. 
[25]Fair enough.  You know I got to Admit, you got a lot of bark on You comin' up here like this. 
[26]Ain't our way.  We go all on one, One on all.  Fight one of us, you Fight us all.  That's the Cowboy way. 
[27]Oh, we ride for a brand all right. This brand.  How 'bout you? 
[28]We're gonna get along just fine. 
[29]All right, first thing's first: It's my outfit now, I'm runnin' The show.  Ringo's number two man. 
[30]You ain't got enough in your Britches.  Think you can prove Otherwise, go ahead. 
[31]Anybody else? 
[32]All right.  Billy, go after Ike And cool him off then go find the McLaurys, tell 'em what happened And keep an eye on things.  Wes Fuller and Bill Claiborne, too. Rest of you come with me.  We're Goin' to Mexico. 
[33]I know.  Just did what you had to. That banner and stuff, that's Just Ike.  Don't worry about it. 
[34]Don't worry about a thing 
[35]Here's to the memory of Billy Clanton and Tom and Frank McLaury.  They went out real Cowboys, dead game right up to Their last kick.  They won their Places at the big table with Davy Crockett and Wild Bill and Old Man Clanton.  They're up there Right now tradin' shots with 'em. And they'll never be forgot.  Not Ever.  Hundred years from now There'll be men settin' around a Campfire, passin' a bottle, Tellin' stories about those boys. They're what you call immortal. And I say God bless 'em. 
[36]All right, first we hang back, Just bide away till everybody Thinks this's blown over.  Then... 
[37]So she's Wyatt's slice now.  Looks Like we got another name for the Tally book. 
[38]Johnny, don't, Jesus!  Come on, Son... Never mind.  He's drunk. 
[39]Easy, Johnny.  Now ain't the time. I tell you, boys, even I'm Worried what'll happen once Ringo Runs this outfit!  God have mercy! 
[40]Easy, son.  You just need to get Your feet back under you, that's All.  Come on, boy, let's kick South.  Down to the old playground. 
[41]See son, there is a God after all! 
[42]All right, boys.  Now's the time To get woolly. 
[43]Naw, she's nobody.  Wyatt junked her. 
[44]Well... 'bye. 
[45]Oh, Jesus, Johnny... 
[46]Take Frank and finish it. 
[47]Easy now, it's only five men. Been havin' it their way 'cause They been surprising you.  Hittin' The waterholes and that Judas McMasters is showin' 'em right Where they are.  Pretty damn cute. But nobody's cute as me. Next up's Black Draw.  But that Smart Wyatt'll say no, that's Where they'll expect us to hit, We'll hit the one after.  Iron Springs.  That's where they show Next.  Only I'm gonna be there First.  And throw a little party. 
[48]Hey, Wyatt!  How the hell are you? 
[49]Got some boys workin' around Those rocks behind you.  Another Minute or two, gonna have you in A crossfire!  How do you like that? 
[50]'Course you could give yourselves up and we could have a party! Then what larks! 
[51]Look at that!  Yeah!  Come and get Some, boy! 
[52]Let me, let me, yeah!  Die, you Bastard... 
[53]Die!  Son of a bitch!  Die!
dialogues.JOSEPHINE:
[1]Interesting little scene.  I Wonder who that tall man was. 
[2]Oh, I want one. 
[3]The man dealing faro.  Who is he? 
[4]A peace officer... Impressive man 
[5]Oh, so that's it... 
[6]Maybe even my destiny. 
[7]Well, hello. 
[8]Wyatt Earp, I know.  I was Beginning to think we'd never Meet.  This is fortuitous.  That Means lucky. 
[9]What is it? 
[10]Oh... Now she's starting.  How do they know? 
[11]I have a better idea, let's run It out of them! 
[12]That was lovely! 
[13]Fun though, wasn't it? 
[14]Wouldn't you?  You're laughing!  I Was sure you never laughed. 
[15]Yes, but how often?  Tell me, are You happy? 
[16]You're a little touchy about it. 
[17]Of course, I'm always happy. Unless I'm bored.  That blonde Woman, is that your wife? 
[18]Nothing... Tell me, what do you Want out of life? 
[19]Just answer. 
[20]Doesn't suit you. 
[21]Just doesn't, that's all. 
[22]Room service. 
[23]See?  You're laughing again.  But That's what I want.  Go places and Move and never look back and just Have fun.  Forever.  That's my idea Of heaven.  Need someone to share It with, though. 
[24]Well he's handsome and he's Charming.  He's all right.  For Now.  Don't say it, I know, I'm Rotten.  I can't help it.  I've Tried to be good but it's too Boring. 
[25]Oh look, I haven't got time to be Proper, I want to live.  I'm a woman, I like men.  If that's Unladylike then I guess I'm not a Lady.  At least I'm honest. 
[26]What's wrong? 
[27]I know, me too.  What should we do About it? 
[28]You know this is adultery.  You Burn in hell for that. 
[29]I must say this certainly has Been an unexpected little Windfall. 
[30]And I don't even know your full name. 
[31]And I'm Josephine Sarah Marcus. My friends call me Josie. 
[32]I hate Sadie. 
[33]Always? 
[34]So I assume we're regarding this As just a kind of interlude. 
[35]You feel bad about this?  About me? 
[36]You know you don't have to sneak. You could stay with me.  I know Things, Wyatt.  Sweet things.  I Could make you so happy. 
[37]...all of me. 
[38]Because I'm wonderful. 
[39]Absolutely nothing. 
[40]Not now.  I don't have time. 
[41]My man?  You told Wyatt you'd Disarmed those men.  Do you Actually believe after that I Could see you as my man?  You're Just a dirty little fixer. 
[42]I don't understand. 
[43]Please, I know it's awful me Coming here, but listen, I can't Say why, but I think something is- 
[44]No!  Look out! 
[45]Wyatt... 
[46]We're headed for a booking in Denver.  They tried to take my Watch.  He cursed them for cowards And they shot him.  He may've been Vain and an actor but he was Better than all of you.  And Gentler and braver.  I don't Understand any of this, I only Know it's ugly.  You're all ugly And he was beautiful, he tried to Put something fine into your ugly World and you killed him for it. Anyway the ones who did it are headed north.  Not that you care. 
[47]I forgave you the moment you said it. 
[48]I have to go. 
[49]I know, it's- 
[50]Wyatt!  My God... 
[51]Don't worry, Wyatt.  My family's rich.
dialogues.VIRGIL:
[1]Wyatt, you remember Allie 
[2]But she doted on the frowner 
[3]Mrs. Earp?  Land O' love, it finally happened!  Mattie it's a Pleasure! 
[4]Look at him go, will ya?  I tell You, that's the real Wyatt, born In the saddle. 
[5]Try to be a lady, will you? 
[6]Mighty fine.  Wonder where he Found her.  Same place we found Ours probably 
[7]Well here we are a family again. Been so long plain forgot how Good it feels.  Want to thank you For that, Wyatt.  All your doin'. 
[8]Oh, God, here he goes... 
[9]Hit a streak when we left.  Him And Kate. 
[10]I don't 
[11]The Cowboys, yeah.  I heard of 'em. 
[12]Look pretty rough. 
[13]Doesn't anybody raise a stink? The hell kinda town is this? 
[14]Acquired? 
[15]What kinda town is this? 
[16]Her maiden name was Sullivan. 
[17]All right, look out!  Break it up. Go home, all of you, go home now... 
[18]Keep your eye on that brass ring. Don't let anything side-track you. 
[19]Come on Mayor, he already told You no. 
[20]I'm busy.  We're all busy.  Sorry, Mayor, but you're really barkin' Up the wrong tree. 
[21]I can't hardly believe it.  It's Working out just like you said, Wyatt.  We're lootin' this burg Six ways through Sunday. 
[22]Kinda, actually, yeah.  I gotta admit. 
[23]What're you up to today, son? 
[24]I couldn't help it, Wyatt.  I Looked at that woman and it was Just like somebody slapping me in The face.  I mean these people're Afraid to even walk down the Street and I'm trying to make Money off it like some kind of God damn vulture.  That's not me, That's somebody I don't even know. 
[25]It's got nothin' to do with you, Wyatt.  It's- 
[26]Nothin' to it. 
[27]Wait a minute, you thinkin' of Getting in bed with the Cowboys? 
[28]You are the one, Wyatt.  You sure are. 
[29]Come on, boys, take it easy. 
[30]That's enough, Clanton. 
[31]Nobody's in anything, Clanton, You're drunk.  Go home and sleep It off. 
[32]Don't you threaten me, you Little- 
[33]Billy Clanton, Wes Fuller, and Billy Claiborne.  Now there's six Of 'em.  This is like a bad dream. 
[34]Here they are again.  Look at 'em. 
[35]What the hell're we gonna do? 
[36]Wyatt, they're threatening our lives. 
[37]They're carrying guns in town. 
[38]No, damn it, it's wrong, they're Breakin' the law. 
[39]Wyatt, I know what I'm doin'. 
[40]You did?  Great, thanks.  Come on, boys. 
[41]We've come to arrest you.  Throw Up your arms! 
[42]Hold!  I don't want that! 
[43]Getting warmer.  Guess spring's comin'. 
[44]What d'you want, Ringo? 
[45]Gonna be one of those nights. 
[46]Getting late.  Guess I'll turn in. 
[47]Wyatt... 
[48]Wyatt! 
[49]No, no, don't worry, honey.  I Still got one arm left to hug you with. 
[50]For God's sake, just leave me alone.
dialogues.RINGO:
[1]That's not what he said, you Ignorant wretch.  Your spanish is Worse than your English.  Come on, Let's get it over with. 
[2]You first. 
[3]He was quoting the bible, Revelations: "Behold a pale horse And the one that sat on him was Death and Hell followed with him." 
[4]I already did it. 
[5]And you must be Doc Holliday. 
[6]You retired, too? 
[7]Yeah, you look it. 
[8]Age quod agis. 
[9]Ecentus stultorum magister. 
[10]I want your blood and I want you Souls and I want them both right now. 
[11]Well you got trouble and it Starts with you. 
[12]Wretched slugs, don't any of you Have the guts to play for blood? 
[13]All right, lunger.  Have at it. 
[14]Here it come: one-two- 
[15]I want them spitting blood! 
[16]There's no God, there's no devil, I hate the God damn world!  I want To die! 
[17]Hey, you smell that?  Smells like Something died. 
[18]Curly Bill?  He killed Curly Bill? 
[19]He's just a man. 
[20]You see my face, don't you? 
[21]Everybody get this through their Heads.  Wyatt Earp dies.  I'm Running the show now and I'm Telling you, Earp dies.  His men Too.  They all die.  Understand? We're gonna kill 'em.  For what They did to Curly Bill we're Gonna ride 'em into the ground And slaughter 'em like rabbits. 'Cause this is my time, children. This is where I get woolly. 
[22]You heard me, Behan. 
[23]No, you don't understand. 
[24]Who cares?  Separate the wheat From the chaff. 
[25]Sure, why not? 
[26]I told you it was time to get Woolly.  Now gather 'round, Children, gather 'round.  And Raise your right hands. 
[27]Let him go.  Who cares? 
[28]Hooker's got around 15 or 16 Hands.  We could take 'em right Enough but it might be a mess. Keep the place bottled up for Now, see if we can figure a way To flush 'em. 
[29]Well hello, Sherm. 
[30]Yeah, kinda, wanted to see if you'd join back up with us. 
[31]You're a Cowboy, you're a Brother.  Come back, no hard Feelings. 
[32]Isn't there anything I can say That'll change your mind?  You're Gonna stay with your new friends? 
[33]You're the boss.  One thing, though. 
[34]How you gonna get back to 'em? 
[35]Only three.  They left somebody Behind.  Let's go take a look. 
[36]Who's in there? 
[37]Drag him out here, let's have a look. 
[38]All right, Hooker.  I'll be back In about an hour.  We'll see how Brave you are then. 
[39]Soon as I'm through with Wyatt, Swarm down with the whole bunch And finish off Creek Johnson and Texas Jack. 
[40]Well, didn't think you had it in you. Shall we? 
[41]My fight's not with you, Holliday. 
[42]I was kidding about that. 
[43]All right, lunger.  Let's do it.
dialogues.BEHAN:
[1]Newcomers, eh?  Names John Behan, I'm Cochise County Sheriff.  Just Hit town? 
[2]Wyatt Earp...Dodge City, right? 
[3]Well I'm the man to see.  Besides Sheriff I'm also tax collector, Captain of the Fire Brigade, and Chairman of the Non-partisan Anti- Chinese league.  A man of many Parts.  Got a place to stay yet?  I Also sit on the Townlot Commission.  Got a couple of Lovely cottages coming up for Rent.  Here, let me show you... 
[4]The one next door and the one Across the street are vacant too. Same rent and I'll throw in a Good cleaning.  Believe me, you Won't find a better deal within Town limits. 
[5]So how's Tombstone treating you? 
[6]Actually, you know, that's not a Bad idea, send a signal we're Growing up. 
[7]See how everyone dresses?  Awfully Toney for a mining camp.  No, the Die's cast, we're growing, be as Big as San Francisco in a few Years.  And just as sophisticated. 
[8]That must be the theatrical Troupe.  There's a show tonight at Schieffelin Hall. 
[9]That's Wyatt Earp.  Made quite a Name for himself as a peace Officer in Kansas. 
[10]Yes, very.  And very married. 
[11]Have you been out in the street? Somebody's got to do something. 
[12]It's not County business, it's a Town matter. 
[13]Well I guess you can see, never a Dull moment.  Maybe you should Stay around to see what happens Next.  Who know?  You might find a Future here. 
[14]What d'you think of the singer? 
[15]That's not what I meant. 
[16]I saw that look on your face just now. What's between you and Wyatt? 
[17]I'm terribly afraid this looks Like the end of the Earp brothers. 
[18]They're on their way over here. 
[19]You don't have to worry about a Thing.  I just went down there and Disarmed them. 
[20]Come on! 
[21]All right.  You're all under Arrest. 
[22]Listen, I want to talk to you. 
[23]I saw that look pass between you And Wyatt at the fight.  Listen to Me!  You're mine!  Understand? You're my woman and I'm your man. 
[24]You whore!  You filthy whore! 
[25]Look, I don't want to take Advantage of an injured man but You better- 
[26]Easy.  I just wanted to tell you Things're about to start changing Around here.  Lots of so-called Hard cases and tough-nuts swagger Around this town but none of 'em's got a clue about the real play.  None of 'em. 
[27]You will after tonight.  Bet on it. 
[28]Are you crazy?  It's front page News all over the country.  It's Getting out of hand, Ringo.  If Things don't settle down soon- 
[29]Ringo, you don't understand- 
[30]What're you doing here, Billy? 
[31]Robbery.  2 men stuck 'em up and Killed a passenger.  One of 'em Rode a Mexican saddle, the other Had a Mother Hubbard.  Billy Grounds and Zwing Hunt. 
[32]Where're you going?  Get back here! 
[33]It's too much!  It's completely Out of hand!  Governor Gosper's Talking about asking the President to send in the Army! Listen Ringo, you've got to get This over with and you've got to Do it now.  One way or another. 
[34]Aren't we giving them safe conduct? 
[35]Well I guess Ringo did it. 
[36]What? 
[37]Oh, no... 
[38]Me too!
dialogues.MORGAN:
[1]Well how do we look? 
[2]Give him some good exercise?  Sure Some stud.  Some string in fact. What're you gonna do, race 'em? 
[3]Come up, Lou.  Come up here, girl. 
[4]Boy, look at all those stars.  Bet You can see every star there is. Practical touch 'em.  Kinda makes You think, you know?  I mean you Look up and you think God made All that but he still remembered To make a little speck like me. Kinda flattering really.  Hey, Wyatt, you believe in God?  No, Come on, really, do you? 
[5]Well what do you think happens When you die? 
[6]I read this book, book on Spiritualism... 
[7]...said a lot of people, when they're dyin', they see this light, like in a tunnel.  They say it's the light leading you to heaven. 
[8]Hey, Wyatt, God damn it, I'm serious! 
[9]Wyatt, meet Fred White, he's town marshal. 
[10]Going into business for Ourselves.  Wyatt just got us a Faro game. 
[11]It's that woman from the coach! 
[12]Hey Doc!  Come on now. 
[13]Now that wounds me.  Little tin Swain walkin' off with that black Beauty.  I mean I'm a married man And all but still, it ain't right. 
[14]Boy, I love this game.  When we're Finally set we gotta each have a Billiard room in our houses. 
[15]Like you said, Wyatt.  We're Brothers.  Gotta back your Brother's play.  Just did like I Figured you would. 
[16]Come on, we're not about pickin' Fights.  Just gonna keep a little Order, that's all. 
[17]Like you said, just gotta know How to handle 'em.  Old Fred Wasn't up to it.  We know that We're doin', Wyatt. 
[18]What're you talkin' about? 
[19]Doc won't quit, been up 36 hours. Clanton came in an hour ago, they Switched over to poker.  Tried to Get him to bed but he just won't Let go. 
[20]What're you doin' out of bed, Doc? 
[21]I'm hit. 
[22]Fine.  Better. 
[23]You were right.  It's nothin' like I thought.  I almost wish... 
[24]You don't talk that way to a Female human being!  Not ever! 
[25]Dropped him, that was it.  Sorry If I made a worse mess for you. 
[26]Hello, Billy.  I say hello, Deputy. 
[27]That thunder's sure somethin'. 
[28]Get down, boy. 
[29]What's it look like?  They want a Piece of me they can come and get It, I'm not crawlin' into my hole. 
[30]I am usin' it, Wyatt.  Been Wonderin' how the hell we got in This tangle.  You know they hit Clum's house, too?  Shot up his wife. His wife.  Who ever heard of That?  Men sneakin' around in the Dark, back-shootin', scarin' Women?  They're bugs, Wyatt.  You Know all your smart talk about Live and let live?  Ain't no live And let live with bugs. 
[31]Listen to yourself, Wyatt.  Lie Down and crawl or you might get Hurt?  What kinda talk is that? That's Virgil lyin' over there, Wyatt.  Our own brother.  Ruined For life.  No sir, I ain't going No place.  You want to go, fine. I'm stayin' right here and have It out with those bastards. 
[32]How much you wanna bet? 
[33]You're on. 
[34]You were right, Wyatt.  They got Me good.  Don't let 'em get you Too. 
[35]Remember about the light you're Supposed to see when you're dyin'? 
[36]Isn't true.  I can't see a damn thing.
dialogues.MCMASTERS:
[1]Run for your lives, boys!  It's That great two-gun dog-catcher From Kansas! 
[2]Look, I got a rule.  I don't talk To lawmen.  Dog-catchers neither. 
[3]Well in that case, I saw your Horse.  Billy Clanton was takin' Him up to the Cut to show him Off.  The boys're all up there Right now, branding.  And in a Mood.  Still want your property Back, Mr. Private Citizen? 
[4]If I had to explain it you Wouldn't understand.  Just say We're brothers to the bone. 
[5]There's all kinds of horses, Ain't there?  Same with Cowboys. What they do's their affair.  I Don't preach and I don't judge.  I Ain't no dog-catcher. 
[6]You seem like a nice fella.  Like To've know you better.  Had you lived. 
[7]No, wait.  Please.  I know nothin' I say'll fix things but I want You to know it wasn't me. 
[8]Not anymore, not after this. 
[9]It might be done.  If we hit the Waterholes through the southern Dragoons, the Whetstones and Huachucas, we could take 'em on In pieces, run off their herds. Keep your money, I'll show you Where those waterholes are.  Just Promise me you'll finish it.  No Matter what happens you'll see it Through to the end.  I'll have Your hand on that. 
[10]I ain't your brother, I ain't None of your damn brothers.  Move! 
[11]Florentino!  He's getting away! 
[12]But this time they'll be ready. 
[13]What'd you do that for? 
[14]Next waterhole's Black Draw.  We Could be there by mid-morning. 
[15]There they are.  No herd though. 
[16]Ambush!  Get down! 
[17]He's right.  They get set up in Them rocks it's the end for us. 
[18]Think of somethin' fast or we're cooked. 
[19]Where's Wyatt? 
[20]That's Ringo out front.  And There's Behan.  Must be 30 of 'em. What the hell... they're wearin' Badges. 
[21]He didn't figure on all the stink This is causin'.  Might be he's lookin' to strike a bargain.  If So, he probably figures he needs Somebody like me who talks his Language.  Could be we got him. 
[22]Might as well hear him out. Anyways, what choice we got? But no matter what happens, see It through to the end.  If you don't I'll curse the day I ever laid eyes on you. 
[23]You wanted to talk? 
[24]That what you got me up here for? 
[25]Forget it, Ringo. 
[26]'Least they don't scare women.
dialogues.JOHNSON:
[1]That's right, keep comin', keep comin'... 
[2]Yeah, good.  Right about there. 
[3]Hello, Wyatt!  Hiya Doc! 
[4]Fair fight.  We were legal. 
[5]Hey, Wyatt, you goin' to the Show?  Maybe we'll see you there. Won't we. 
[6]There they go.  Look kinda like preachers. 
[7]Are you out of your mind?  What on Earth'd make us- 
[8]You crazy?  It can't be done. 
[9]Crapped out.  Okay, we're in. 
[10]Like flyin', son.  Just like flyin'. 
[11]Not so sure.  Somethin' tells me It gets harder from here in. Should've held out for more money. 
[12]Maybe you ought to have a talk With Doc, Wyatt.  I don't know if He's gonna make it. 
[13]Christ! 
[14]What? 
[15]How is he? 
[16]Never even heard of anything like it. 
[17]One thing.  We come through this Alive, can we keep the badges? 
[18]Good God, you're really- 
[19]Wyatt, are you crazy? 
[20]He's right, Wyatt.  Ringo could Put five into you before you Could even get one into him. 
[21]All right Wyatt, maybe you can. But you gotta die to do it. Understand?  You gotta die! 
[22]Wyatt, I... I ain't got the words. 
[23]I'll be dipped in shit.  I will, too. 
[24]Colorado's closer 
[25]It rides right at 'em.  Like McMasters said, see it through to The end.
dialogues.VERMILLION:
[1]Easy, gents. Private affair... Wyatt! Doc! Hey! 
[2]Drunks.  Crawfished a bet, called Him a liar.  I saw the whole thing. 
[3]Well law and order every time, That's us. 
[4]Nice scenery. 
[5]Yeah.  Or undertakers. 
[6]Way ahead of you, Wyatt.  You want Us to help you get Ike Clanton And Johnny Behan.  Everybody knows They're the ones to blame for Your brothers. 
[7]500... Year's wages.  And I never even saw a horse like that. 
[8]We come through this in one Piece, can we keep the horses? 
[9]You know, we might just pull this off. 
[10]Sorry... 
[11]You really look awful. 
[12]Then why in hell're you doin' This?  You ought to be in bed. 
[13]Hell, I got lot's of friends. 
[14]Ain't takin' me alive, damn it! 
[15]Yeah, better run, you bastards! 
[16]What?  But I saw 'em- 
[17]Hey Creek, you ever see anything Like that before? 
[18]I just thought of somethin' I Never thought about before. I don't want to go to hell. 
[19]Talked it over.  We decided we Don't need the money.  Took out 13 Dollars each, though.  Federal Posseman's fee.  That all right? 
[20]Doc's just in no kinda shape. 
[21]Why couldn't they've jus killed him? 
[22]Wyatt, listen, you can't beat Him.  You're good and God knows You got the courage, but you Ain't in Ringo's class.  Hell, He's the best that's ever been. 'Cept maybe for Wild Bill. 
[23]Praise Jesus! 
[24]We're the law, ain't we?  Well the Law don't ride around vermin-
dialogues.IKE:
[1]Listen, Mr. Kansas Law-dog.  Law Don't go around her.  Savvy? 
[2]Yeah, that's good, Mr. Law-dog, 'cause law don't go around here. 
[3]Turn loose of him. 
[4]Swear to God, Mister, step aside Or we'll tear you apart. 
[5]Hey, law-dog.  The hell you doin' here? 
[6]Don't sweet-talk him, make a move. 
[7]Come on, Curly!  Don't let him- 
[8]Your outfit?  I'm next in line. 
[9]Son of a bitch!  That's twelve Straight hands!  Nobody's that lucky. 
[10]I'll wring your scrawny neck for you! 
[11]You takin' his part?  I'm the one Was cheated. God damn pimps, You're all in it together. 
[12]Get your God damn hands off me! Don't you ever put your hands on One of us!  Don't you ever try to Man-handle a Cowboy!  We'll out Your God damn pimp's heart out! Understand, pimp? 
[13]I ain't forgettin' nothin. 
[14]What's wrong with him? 
[15]Bastards think they can cheat me? 
[16]And I don't take no mouth from Any bartenders neither.  There, See?  Give somebody a rap on the beezer, get some God damn respect Around here.  Now you tell the Earps and Doc Holliday if I see 'em on the street, I'm gonna send 'em all to hell on a shutter.  You tell 'em that. 
[17]I want to send a telegram. 
[18]Gimme that. 
[19]No, no, please!  I don't have a gun! 
[20]Get ready.  Soon as Ringo's done We're gonna take care of the others. 
[21]Sure we are.  All the way to hell. 
[22]All right, get ready... 
[23]Kill 'em!  Kill 'em!  It's only Four men!  Why don't you kill 'em?
dialogues.MATTIE:
[1]Wyatt, I couldn't find a single Store that had laudanum any- 
[2]Oh, he can go all right. 
[3]Rather ride than eat. 
[4]You're a lifesaver!  Don't worry, I just get headaches sometimes. 
[5]I think I'll just lie down awhile 
[6]Long as I live I'll never Get used to that sound. 
[7]You get lonely? 
[8]I hope they're good. 
[9]No, stay.  Please stay with me. 
[10]Oh, all right. 
[11]No, no, I don't want to keep you. 
[12]Just go.  It's all right.  Wyatt, Really.  Work well. 
[13]I know what I'm doing.  Where have You been? 
[14]I don't know.  I'm all right. 
[15]Sure I'm sure.  What is this? 
[16]Wyatt, what're you talkin' about? 
[17]Thought you swore you'd never Carry that thing again. 
[18]I need it. 
[19]Admit what, I'm an opium fiend? No, Wyatt, I just said I need it. I need something to keep me warm At night. 
[20]You know nothing.  What you don't Know would fill a book.  Jesus, I Feel like it's when you're around I need it most.  You're never Yourself, you never relax.  Never. Everything's so stiff and dead. You always have to keep a rein on Everything, ever yourself.  Oh, You smile sometimes, I've even Seen you laugh.  But there's no Light in your smile for me, Wyatt, nothing to keep me warm. And I get cold, Wyatt.  I get so cold. What's between you and that Jew woman? 
[21]Will you go to her and tell her Right in front of me she's Nothing to you?  Right out loud so I can hear?  Tell her she's Nothing, tell her she's nobody, Just dirt?  Will you do that? 
[22]Until you can do that we've got Nothing to talk about, Wyatt. Nothing.  Now leave me alone.
dialogues.WHITE:
[1]Who, Behan?  He ain't no law, only Real law here's the Cowboys. 
[2]Nobody does nothin' without 'em. They're it.  Hell, even the Apache're scared of 'em.  There's A couple right there: Sherman McMasters and Pony Deal.  Can Always spot a Cowboy, they all Wear those red sashes. 
[3]Well I'm no Wild Bill.  Way I Handle 'em's just mainly live and Let live.  That usually answers But even so, gets kinda spooky Sometimes.  Still somebody's gotta Do it, I mean how the hell else You gonna walk down the street? 
[4]Boomtown.  Wide open.  People Grabbin' with both hands ain't Got time for any law and order. In fact the less law the more Opportunities there are for Makin' money.  Plain fact is the Cowboys're good for business. 
[5]Ah, now that's the real mother- Lode in Tombstone.  Up and down Allen Street, full-blast 24 hours A day, liquor, hostesses, Gamblin', makin' money hand over Fist.  All except the Oriental.  On Account of the element.  Have a Man for breakfast in there most Days.  Regular slaughter house. High-rollers won't go near it. Too bad, nice place. 
[6]'Fraid I'll have to have those guns. 
[7]Sorry, boys.  Gotta take you Before Judge Spicer. 
[8]Yeah, probably. 
[9]Wyatt, this is Mayor Clum and his wife. 
[10]Well everybody's here except the Old Man.  Got the blade, Billy Grounds, Zwing Hunt, Billy Claiborne, Wes Fuller, Tom and Frank McLaury, Billy Clanton's The youngest.  Wild one.  Then the Breeds, Hank Swilling, Pony Deal. Florentino's Mex-breed.  They all Hate Mex, but he hates 'em Special.  Johnny Barnes, Frank Stillwell.  That's Behan's little Deputy, Billy Breakenridge. Follows the Cowboys around like a Puppy.  And the big boys: Curly Bill Brocius, he's the Old Man's Rimrod; the one looks like an Actor, that's Johnny Ringo.  Best Gun alive they say.  He's kinda Different.  Curly Bill's the only One he talks to.  I mean they're All rough boys, but Ringo... I Don't know.  I really don't 
[11]Since when'd you start servin' Ladies in here? 
[12]Come on now.  We don't want any Trouble in here.  Not in any language. 
[13]See what I mean about it getting Spooky? 
[14]Ike Clanton, Old Man's eldest Son.  Know he ain't got the stuff, Makes him miserable. 
[15]Curly Bill.  He's over across the Street shootin' out the lights. 
[16]No, I gotta do something.  I don't Suppose you'd card- 
[17]Hey, Curly?  Come on now, boy... 
[18]Hand that over.  Come on now.
dialogues.HOOKER:
[1]That's right.  And I'm Hooker. 
[2]Look, Mister, it's fine for you Boomers to court trouble, you're Just passin' through.  Us Cattlemen gotta live here.  Best I Can do's point you up to the cut. That's their roost. 
[3]You can put up at my ranch if you want. 
[4]I'm no doctor but he looks pretty bad. 
[5]Had a holdup.  Came her to water Their horses before pushin' on. 
[6]...brought 'em in draped over their saddles.  Little Billy Breakenridge.  Sister Boy.  He done It.  So I guess the law's finally Arrived in southeast Arizona. 
[7]Don't have to bother about that. Took a vote.  Cowboys or not, you Can stay here as long as you want. Anyway maybe you done enough.  I Mean you whittled 'em down Considerable, now there's talk of Sendin' the Army in here.  Ask me, You done enough. 
[8]Don't worry.  They want him They'll have to go over us first. 
[9]What're you doin' here? 
[10]It's Holliday.  He's sick.  Imagine He's dyin'. 
[11]I looked the other way when you Did a lot of foul things but I Ain't lettin' you torment a dyin' Man.  Not as long as he's under my Roof.  I draw the line there. 
[12]I'll be here.
dialogues.ALLIE:
[1]Good God, well he better. 
[2]Can he then? 
[3]Uh, that woman. 
[4]Neither do I. 
[5]This is so much fun!  We haven't Been to a show since years. 
[6]Not tonight! Tonight me and my Old man're gonna have some fun. Get moving, old man! 
[7]God, it's a cold night.  Come up To the fire, Mattie. 
[8]Now who in... It's another woman. 
[9]Oh, no, no, no, NO! 
[10]Look, Wyatt, I don't want to talk Right now. 
[11]He doesn't want to talk now.
dialogues.KATE:
[1]Here, Doc. 
[2]Touch that gun, I burn you down! 
[3]I been having the boy at the Hotel pack us up every night Since your streak started 
[4]You don't even know him. 
[5]That's my lovin' man.  Just can't Get enough. 
[6]That's right.  Doc can go all day And all night and then some. Doc's my man.  Doc's my lovin' Man.  Have another one, lovin' man. 
[7]What's wrong, Doc? 
[8]How you feeling, Doc? 
[9]That's good.  I knew it wasn't nothin'. 
[10]What's that mean, Doc?  You know I Don't understand when you talk up High like that.  You mean you Don't want to be my lovin' man no more? 
[11]I'm a good woman to you, Doc. Don't I always take care of you? Nobody cares for you like me.  I'm A good woman.
dialogues.BREAKENRIDGE:
[1]Oh, he wonderful! 
[2]Here, Mr Fabian, have this table. 
[3]Mr. Fabian, I've got to tell you, That's the most wonderful thing I Ever saw.  What was that? 
[4]I don't want to talk to you.  Those Men you killed were my friends. I'm just a nothing, but if I Wasn't I'd fight you, I'd fight You right now.  So I don't wanna Talk to you. 
[5]Curly Bill was my friend.  I'd Like to come with you. 
[6]Oh, no... 
[7]It's Deputy Breakenridge. 
[8]You shouldn't've killed Mr. Fabian.  You shouldn't've done That.  It was wrong.  I'm takin' You both in for it. 
[9]Don't want to kill you but I will If I have to.  I'm warning you. 
[10]Don't try it! 
[11]Sorry.
dialogues.JOYCE:
[1]What can I get you? 
[2]Milt Joyce, owner-operator. 
[3]You see that bird at the faro Table?  That's Johnny Tyler.  He Barged in here one day, said he Was takin' over the game, started Slappin' customer, wavin' his Gun around, scarin' off all the High-class play.  Only trade comes In here now's just bummers and Drovers, just the dregs. 
[4]Well sure, neighbor, easy to say. 
[5]Actresses.  It's different. 
[6]New singer.  Ain't she somehin'? 
[7]Lunger. 
[8]Nobody cheated you, Ike.  Go home. 
[9]Those Cowboys're tellin' Everybody in town they're gonna Clean you out.  They're down in That lot right now behind the OK Corral.
dialogues.TYLER:
[1]You back that Queen again, you Son of a bitch, I'll blow you Right out of that chair! Somethin' on your mind? 
[2]That a fact? 
[3]For a man that don't go heeled You run your mouth kinda reckless. 
[4]That a fact? 
[5]Well I'm real scared. 
[6]Listen Mister, I'm getting' tired- 
[7]Doc.  I didn't know you were in town. 
[8]Wyatt?  Wyatt Earp? 
[9]Thank you.
dialogues.HUNT:
[1]Hey, Sister Boy! 
[2]Hell no, brother. 
[3]Right with you, brother. 
[4]What's it gonna be, brother? 
[5]Just what we need.  Travelin' money. 
[6]No fire tonight, son.  Too many Riders out. 
[7]Who's that? 
[8]Sister Boy!  Thank God, we was afraid- 
[9]What?  You gotta be kiddin'.  Look, Just go home 'fore you get hurt.
dialogues.BILLY:
[1]He said to turn loose of him. 
[2]He's bluffin'!  Let's rush him! 
[3]Hell, he can't hit nothin'.  He's So drunk he's probably seein' Double. 
[4]Beauty, ain't he? 
[5]Where do you think?  I stole him. 
[6]Come and get him. 
[7]Probably already scared them to death. 
[8]More cartridges!  Somebody load my gun... 
[9]I'm sorry, sir, but we got to Have some law.
dialogues.STILLWELL:
[1]What're you lookin' at? 
[2]Lady, they better be good. 
[3]Hey profesor!  Catch this! 
[4]How come he ain't wearin' no pants? 
[5]He's gonna some up short on that one. 
[6]Old Man Clanton's dead!  Ambushed In Guadaloupe Canyon.  Messican's Got him. 
[7]That's Virgil with the women.  But Where the hell's Wyatt?
dialogues.FABIAN:
[1]Only thing we can do, dear-be Good.  In any event, at least we Won't have to wait for our Notices.  Exciting, isn't it?  Now This is theater! 
[2]Ladies and gentlemen, the St Crispin's Day Speech from Henry V. To set the Scene, England is Now at war with France. Everything rests upon the battle About to begin.  Henry, the young King of England, addresses his men Thusly: "My cousin Westmorland? No, my fair cousin-" 
[3]"If we are marked to die, we are enow/ To do our country loss; and if to live./ The fewer me, the greater the share of honour..." 
[4]"We few, we happy few, we band of brothers;/ For he today that sheds his blood with me/ Shall be my brother; be he ne'er so vile./ This day shall gentle his Condition;/ And gentlemen in England now a-bed/ Shall think Themselves accurs'd they were no Here./ And hold their manhood Cheap whiles any speaks/ That Fought with us upon Saint Crispin's day!" 
[5]Oh, thank you.  You're very kind. 
[6]Henry's all right but he's no Match for the Melancholy Dane. Hamlet, dear friend, the supreme Role of any actor worth his salt. 
[7]Indeed, sir?  How so?
dialogues.HIGH ROLLER:
[1]All right, I'm on fire!  Black Seven, seven stickin' spades. Let's go! 
[2]Told you.  I'm red hot, I'm Blazin'!  Now, red seven.  Seven Stinkin' diamonds.  Look out!  Five Thousand!  Let's go! 
[3]Can't take the heat, get outta The kitchen. 
[4]Damn!  All right, wait a minute... 
[5]Hey, is that "Old Dog Tray"? Sounds like "Old Dog Tray". 
[6]You know, Stephen Foster.  "Oh, Susanna".  "Camptown Races", Stephen-stinkin'-Foster! 
[7]A which?
dialogues.3RD COWBOY:
[1]Billy Grounds and Zwing Hunt ran Out.  Four, five others, too. 
[2]Got a message.  Ringo wants McMaster to come over to our Camp for a parley. 
[3]Ringo wanted to be sure he got Your attention, Marshal.  He wants A straight-up fight, just you and Him, settle this thing once and For all.  You win, we quit the Territory; Ringo wins, your Deputies get safe conduct to the Colorado line.  Sundown today in The oak grove at the mouth of Sulphur Springs Canyon.  Ride out With your escort, we'll meet you. 
[4]He's waitin' for you by the big Oak, quarter mile up that trail. 
[5]Ringo's dead 
[6]They're comin' right at us! 
[7]I think it's time to start Workin' for a livin'.
dialogues.FLORENTINO:
[1]He will not kneel.  He is proud. 
[2]He say he know you killing him. 
[3]He say he is no' afraid, someone Will revenge for him.  A sick Horse. 
[4]Something, I don't know, he talk Fancy, you know, like a priest. Is like, "a sick horse who sits---" 
[5]I don't kill your brother!  I Don't even know him.  I was only Lookout.  It was money, they give Me twelve dollars!  It was money! 
[6]No!
dialogues.DAKE:
[1]"Dear Governor Gosper-in re yours directing action against Cowboys, stop.  Beg to inform have Twice sent deputies to serve Warrants on Cowboy suspects, Stop.  Nothing to show for it but 2 dead deputies, stop.  Short of deputizing U.S. Army am at loss- 
[2]Wyatt Earp?  Oh, right, Dodge City. 
[3]Mr. Earp?  My name's Dake, Crawley Dake.  I'm the U.S. Marshal for- 
[4]Excuse me? 
[5]But wait, you don't understand- 
[6]I see, off to strike it rich, Huh.  All right, fine, wish you Luck.  Tell you this though, never Was a rich man yet didn't wind up With a guilty conscience.
dialogues.BAILEY:
[1]I said that's 500 to you, Holliday.  In or out? 
[2]Oh, for Christ's sake! 
[3]God damn son of a... 
[4]Just pick up your money and go. Sick of listening to you simper. 
[5]Skinny lunger, your guns don't Impress me.  Wasn't for those guns You'd be nothin'. 
[6]Oh, my God...
dialogues.CLUM:
[1]Your reputation precedes you.  I wonder - 
[2]This is great, this is just great. 
[3]You're the Sheriff. 
[4]Excuse me, Wyatt, just a moment, Please, I wanted to try and Reason with you.  We still haven't Found a Marshal and- 
[5]What about you?  You were a lawman. 
[6]I can't thank you enough.  Since You took over there hasn't been a Single problem.  We're finally Becoming a civilized town.
dialogues.BARNES:
[1]Professor Gilllman?  Oh hell, I Seen him in Bisbee.  He catches stuff. 
[2]That's how come. 
[3]He's got nerve, I'll say that. What do you think, Billy? 
[4]Look out! 
[5]Hey, you can't come- 
[6]Jesus Christ!
dialogues.GROUNDS:
[1]Uh-oh, looks like somebody's in love. 
[2]What d'you think?  I didn't think Curly Bill could be killed.  I'm Tellin' you, this whole thing's Gone sour.  We got hands droppin' Like flies and Ringo's flat out Of his mind.  I mean, hell Brother, you feel like ridin' Against Wyatt Earp? 
[3]Then brother let's you and me cut out. 
[4]I don't care.  Colorado, New Mexico, 'long as we're out of the Territory. 
[5]No, I'm warning you, Sister Boy! 
[6]Sister Boy, just go to hell!
